subject: Investing
title: Tokens, Coins, and the Difference
description: Learn Tokens, Coins, and the Difference in one minute.

hook.text: Bitcoin is a coin. Uniswap's UNI is a token. They live on different layers and serve different purposes.

buildup.text: A coin operates on its own blockchainâ€”Bitcoin on Bitcoin's chain, Ether on Ethereum's chain.

discovery.text: A token is built on top of an existing blockchain. Thousands of tokens run on Ethereum using the ERC-20 standard.

twist.text: Some tokens represent governance votes, others represent real-world assets, and some are purely speculative.

climax.text: Understanding whether you're buying a coin or a token tells you about its security model and utility.

punchline.text: Coins power networks. Tokens ride on them. Know which you're holding.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a coin from a token?
options: Coins have their own blockchain; tokens are built on existing ones
